bibl.title: Egyptian Literature.
bibl.note: Imagining Egypt in Hellenistic literature and classical scholarship. - The language situation in Ptolemaic Egypt. - Sources: Production, transmission, and preservation. - The major genres: Traditions and transformations. - A borderland of Greek and Egyptian literature. - Tradition and innovation in an intercultural poetics.
bibl.seg: Jacco Dieleman & Ian S. Moyer, Egyptian Literature.
James J. Clauss & Martine Cuypers (edd.), A Companion to Hellenistic Literature = Blackwell Companions to the Ancient World. Literature and Culture (Malden, MA - Oxford, 2010) pp. 429-447.

Imagining Egypt in Hellenistic literature and classical scholarship. - The language situation in Ptolemaic Egypt. - Sources: Production, transmission, and preservation. - The major genres: Traditions and transformations. - A borderland of Greek and Egyptian literature. - Tradition and innovation in an intercultural poetics.
